text: is a Shinto shrine in the city of Yawata in Kyoto Prefecture, Japan. == Shinto belief == People worship Hachiman at the shrine. Hachiman is the Shinto kami of Imperial legitimacy.Kanda, Christine Guth. (1985). Shinzō: Hachiman Imagery and Its Development, p. 41. Since it was built in 859, Hachiman has been recognized as Emperor Ojin.Ponsbonby-Fane, Studies, pp. 78, 196. == Related pages == * List of Shinto shrines * Twenty-Two Shrines * Modern system of ranked Shinto shrines == Notes == == References == * Breen, John and Mark Teeuwen.
